intro: Acer obtusatum var. ibericum, commonly known as the Iberian maple, is a deciduous tree native to the Iberian Peninsula. It typically grows to a height of 10–15 meters, featuring a rounded crown and smooth, gray bark. The leaves are ovate to elliptical, with a glossy dark green upper surface and a lighter underside, turning yellow in autumn. It produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in early spring, followed by winged samaras as its fruit. This species is well adapted to Mediterranean climates and is often found in rocky or dry soils.
